1.Text:
...That's when I said, "I'll take care of this.
You go on ahead!"
My! What a lovely tale!

...Oh dear, your glass is empty. What would you like
to drink next, Lord Margrave?

Many thanks. Ah, but this is quite surreal having
drinks with the best-selling author Natsume Kafka.
I'm deeply humbled.

Oh, please. Your stories are all so fascinating, Lord
Margrave. They give me inspiration for my novels!

Oh? How flattering. Well then, for my next story...
Yes, why don't I tell you about the recent rise in
low-class aristocrats?

I've heard about that. Apparently, once-insignificant
aristocrats have suddenly increased their assets and
risen to the ranks of the voter class.

Very impressive, Lady Natsume. You have your ear to
the ground. It seems they all made a fortune through
a certain casino.

(It wouldn't hurt to dig deeper into this intel about
a casino in the capital.)

Sounds like quite the lucky break. But how does one
amass such a fortune to become a voter?

I've only been there once myself. You see, the casino
is notorious for its incredibly high rates. It costs
no small sum to play at their tables.

I don't know why they operate that way, but one can
assume there are those willing to take high risks for
high returns.

(It could just be some high-end, exclusive casino,
but the Cult is often behind high-value transactions.
It sounds like something we ought to investigate...)

(Admission into the casino seems more challenging
than anticipated, but that's no excuse not to look
into somewhere that could provide us with a lead
to the Cult.)

That sounds like a highly suspicious...I mean, deeply
fascinating story that stokes my creativity. Would
you take me there sometime?

Well, while I'd be happy to lend you my assistance,
the truth is even I cannot gain access so easily.
What? Even someone such as yourself, Lord Margrave?

Indeed... They have quite the screening process.
The one time I visited, I was really only allowed
entry as I was accompanying a duke.

Ideally, it would be best to receive an introduction
from, or accompany someone close to, the royal
family...
I see... Someone close to the royal family...

(Well...I know a certain someone who's not only
"close to" but "part of" the royal family...)

(Besides...just the thought of asking that woman for
a favor...!)

...In any case, how about the two of us visit a more
affordable casino together—
Absolutely not!
Huh?

What? Oh, I wasn't referring to you, Lord Margrave.
My mind wandered for a moment... Ahahah!
Y-You surprised me there! Ha-hahaha...

(The casino is the most suspicious intel from today.
It seems more challenging than anticipated, but I
can't ignore somewhere that could provide us with
a lead to the Cult.)

(Since a formal introduction or accompanying someone
from the royal family isn't really an option, I'd best
think of another way. Let's see...)
...Hm? This advert is for the very same casino...
...Th-That's it!
A few days later...
Welcome to our casino! Have a welcome drink!

On your left are the card tables! And on your right
are the roulette tables!

Please feel free to join in or spectate! Just follow
the rules and have fun at the tables! Enjoy!
...Whew.

(I lucked out coming across that poster advert
recruiting staff!)

(Being the high-class casino it is, the required
skills were set high, but...)

(I managed to falsify my documents with Gamma's help.
The interview itself was a cakewalk, thanks to that
and my silver tongue!)

(That said, there was a lot to pick up beforehand,
and it wasn't easy learning all the casino etiquette
and rules of the games...but, thanks to that, I can
move about with ease now.)

Let me take your empty glass. What would you like to
drink next?
Here's how this game works...

Please exchange your chips over there! See you again
soon!

...Whew. I might've taken my cover a little too
seriously.

I have a bad habit of getting wrapped up in whatever
I'm doing. I ought to ease up—
N-No way!
Huh?! What is going on?
N-No way! Lemme do it again!
Sir, you're inconveniencing the other customers...

Gimme back the money I gambled! I'll settle for just
half! It's all I've got!

(Judging from the looks of it, he gambled big and
lost all his money. He's making a scene now that
he's broke.)

(Based on my research, each game is based on solid
theories and rates of return.)

(So long as you maintain strict self-discipline, you
shouldn't lose too much money, but...)

(Well, I guess someone has to lose to make the rise
in low-class aristocrats a reality.)
All right, time to get back to work—
Hold on! I-Isn't that?!

2.Text: Wow...
(Pr-Princess Alexia?! What's she doing here?!)

(Well, she's the second princess of Midgar Kingdom.
It's only natural for her to be at a casino that's
reserved mainly for royalty.)

(More importantly, why is she also wearing a bunny
costume? It makes no sense for a princess to be
dressed in one. She must be up to something...

(Judging by the dumb look on her face, I'd say it's
her first time in a casino.)

Hey! I'm a customer! You can't treat me like this!
Lemme go, or else—
Agh?! Aahh...

The safety of our guests is our priority, so we have
rendered him unconscious. We sincerely apologize
for any discomfort this has caused you.

We hope you continue to enjoy your time at our
tables.

(I see. Being the high-class casino that it is, the
staff seem highly competent.)

(Thanks to what just happened, I've managed to figure
out how extensive the security is here.)

(The problem is the princess being here. Since I'm
currently undercover, the presence of someone who
knows my identity is highly risky.)

(It'll be a real problem if she notices me here and
refers to me as "Natsume." I'll need to handle this
as soon as possible.)

(Besides, I assume she's also up to something based
on the fact she's in a bunny costume. I'll stay two
steps ahead and make my move first...!)

I see. Of course, it's only natural some win big
while others lose big.

It serves them right, but I shudder to think of such
a financial fallout...
That's the kind of world this is, Princess.

Huh?! Who're you calling "Princess"?! ...Wait, you're
Natsu—

Just as Alexia is about to say her name, Beta puts
her hand over her mouth.
*muffle, muffle* (Wh-What the heck?!)
Stop. Please, calm down.
Pfft! Wh-What was that for?!

I just need you to promise you won't mention my name
here. Understood?

What's up with all this? Hmph. Anyway, keeping quiet
doesn't benefit me. I won't agree to some annoying
promise.

Oh? Judging by your surprise just now, I'm guessing
you're keeping your identity as a "princess" hidden.
Ulp...

Something tells me I'm not the only one wanting to
keep their name a secret.

Ack. Tit for tat, huh? Fine, I'll keep quiet for your
sake.

Why do you always have to act so entitled? Anyway...
what're you even doing here?

I was invited to this casino today. I'm an official
guest of honor.

Is that so? I see. That's quite an unusual outfit
for an official guest of honor.

Well, um...aristocrat after aristocrat was coming up
to greet me, so I ditched them to avoid the hassle.

That's literally the point of being a guest of
honor...

A-Anyway, my father and sister said I was forbidden
from visiting casinos, so it only made me even more
curious to see what they're all about...

Are you telling me that's why you're disguised as one
of the staff? You do know the staff can't play at the
tables, right?

O-Of course I do! But I only realized that after I
put on the costume, so get off my case!

Besides, you're also wearing a bunny costume.
Explain yourself.
No, don't tell me. I've already figured it out.
Huh?

Allow me to explain. You hit your limits as a writer,
so you switched careers to being a bunny girl!
Elementary, my dear, Natsume.

W-R-O-N-G! My writing career is going just fine,
thank you very much!
Well, that's a shame... That costume suits you.
Is that meant to be a compliment or an insult?

Anyway, I doubt you're willing to say much more.
Fine, then I'm guessing you're conducting some sort
of undercover interview.
Um, something like that—
Hey, new girl! What're you slacking off for?
Oh, my apologies! I'll get back to work immediately!

Well then, if you'll excuse me. Please keep to your
promise, understood?
Honestly. What in the world is she up to?

3.Text:
(Whew... I managed to quiet her for now. For all her
faults, she tends to stick to her word, so it should
be fine.)

(Anyway, I've been observing the casino while working
but haven't seen anything suspicious yet.)

(The security staff network seems extensive, but
I guess it's only natural in a place with so many
dignitaries.)

(And while some customers were making a scene about
cheating, it's likely just sour grapes. At any rate, I'm not
picking up on any nefarious intent from the dealers.)

(They could be running an honest casino on the
surface while all the shady business happens
behind the scenes.)

(It's tough getting a lead on an investigation of
this magnitude, especially if the Cult is involved—)
Hey, new girl.
...Y-Yes?!

You're the new bunny girl who just started today,
aren't you?
Y-Yes...

You've been spending a lot of time spacing out and
seem completely unfocused. Just because it's your
first day doesn't mean we'll go easy on you.

And what's with that notepad? It doesn't look like
something you need for work. How suspicious...
(Damn it, he's sharp!)
Are you...hiding something?
N-No! Nothing at all!

Then let me take a look. If nothing's wrong with it,
I'll return it right away.

(Agh! There's no way I'm showing my notes! Not if
I can help it...)

U-Um... The truth is that I write fiction as a hobby!
I thought I'd never have another opportunity to be in
such a gorgeous place, so I just had to scribble down
ideas in my notepad...

As a writer, I can't let people see the ideas in my
notebook! I-I'm sorry!

...Be that as it may, this isn't an issue I can
overlook. What to do...?
What's going on here?
Huh?!

K-King! Sir! I was instructing this new staff member
who's been absentminded...

(King...?! Does that make him the boss of this
casino?! I hadn't expected the top brass to show
up so suddenly...)

I see. Trouble with new staff, huh? It's a common
occurrence. As usual, I'll leave it to you.

Wait, King, I've something to report. I've discovered
something in this newcomer's background that we
were previously unaware of...
Oh?

She apparently writes fiction as a hobby and was
taking notes about the casino for her stories...
I see. So that was the cause of the trouble.
M-My apologies!

Hmm... No. You don't have to apologize. Furthermore,
there's no need to keep us abreast about all your
hobbies.
Huh?

We employed you for your ability to work effectively.
As long as you can offer value in that area, there
shouldn't be any problem.
(What a generous man! I'm honestly impressed...)

But...you shouldn't be bringing your hobbies to work,
correct?
Ulp. Of course you're right...

(Impeccably dressed, perfect responses, and that
mysterious aura he gives off... There's no doubt
about it. He's the boss of this casino.)

Well, new girl. The fact is your work ethic wasn't up
to par. We could terminate your employment based
on the terms of your contract.
Pl-Please don't!

This casino has a reputation as a high-class venue.
The customer service skills required of newcomers
is incredibly high, and it will take time to find your
replacement.

However, the fact is we hired you because we value
you. So...how about taking on a little gamble?
A g-gamble? What on earth do you mean?

As you know, this is a casino. It's a place where
winners and losers at the game tables determine
all outcomes. Why shouldn't we also gamble to
determine the outcome here?
I see...

The outcome will be absolute. Win, and you gain
something; lose, and you lose something.

If you win, we'll tell you every there is to know
about this casino. We'll even share with you...
our trade secrets.

As for if you lose...let's see, you must reveal your
identity in full.

Fortunately, there are not many customers today,
so the rest of the staff can cover. If we host it as
an event, it should also entertain the customers.

So, what do you say to a serious gamble with those
demands on the line?

(It sounds like I'm simply being assigned to today's
event, but it could also be a trap set by someone
suspicious of me.)

(But my position is highly tenuous. If I refuse,
they'll fire me for sure. I've got no choice but
to comply here... Wait, but—)
M-May I think about it for a moment—
Very well. We accept!
...Huh? W-Wait! Who're you?!

4.Text: Who's this?

As a senior bunny girl, I'm responsible for my
subordinate's mistakes. So will you kindly allow
me to participate as well?

I don't recall this bunny girl in our staff roster...
Forget it. I can't afford to mess up in front of King.
(This woman... What is she playing at?!)
...Very well. The more the merrier.

If you'll excuse us for a moment. We'll make the
necessary preparations and meet up again later.
...What do you think you're doing?

Nothing. I saw an opportunity for a staff member like
myself to join in a game, so I took it. That's all.

...Just to clarify, have you ever gambled at a casino
before?

Of course not. This is my first time stepping into
one.
But don't worry. I sort of get how the rules work.

...Sort of? You'll just hold me back at this rate.
Honestly, I didn't think you were this impulsive...

What's the big deal? I only joined mid conversation,
but it didn't seem like you were in a position to turn
down participating.
W-Well...

I get to join in the games, and you get a reassuring
ally. Sounds like a win-win situation to me.

Not sure about "reassuring," but I guess you're
right. Still—
Jeez, c'mon. It's already decided. Just accept it.

Anyway, the fact is I couldn't just stand by while
you were in trouble. I mean, we're comrades who
promised to help each other.

I'm sorry if I didn't go about it in the smoothest
way, but...

If there's reason behind your actions, why don't you
let me help?
Princess Alexia...
...Fine. Just try not to hold me back.
Sure, you just tell yourself that.
Right back at you.

By the way, you're on your own if we lose, okay?
I'm only here for support.
Y-You petty princess... You just want to gamble...!

Thank you for your patience. The game event will
momentarily commence.
Are you two bunny girls ready?
...Yes, we're ready.

Very well. Here are the rules: we'll play a maximum
of three games, with the victor being whoever wins
best out of two.

The first game is Blackjack. The match will take
place between the dealer and the player.

You'll play a total of 11 rounds. You must win six or
more out of 11 to win the match. Are we clear?
Blackjack...huh? Very well. We accept.

Blackjack...? C-Could you explain the rules, just in
case...?

...Are you telling me you don't know? I thought you
said you sort of get how the rules work...

*sigh* Well, we're off to a good start. Dealer, could
you please explain the rules to her?

Of course, and by the way, I will be your dealer for
this match.

To put it simply, the player whose hand is closest to
21 wins.

Cards 2 through 10 are worth their face value, and
face cards are worth 10. The ace is a powerful card
worth either 1 or 11.

At any rate, whoever's hand is either 21 exactly or
closest to 21 wins. It's a draw if the values are the
same.

One thing to keep in mind is that if the total of
your hand exceeds 22, you bust and lose. As for me,
the dealer, I must keep drawing cards until I reach
17 or more.
Do you understand?
Of course, that's so simple. I understand perfectly.

Feel free to go first. You can enjoy yourself for
three rounds or so.

Oh, are you sure? Heheh. Don't be surprised if your
turn never comes around.

We'll need to win six rounds, so I'm pretty sure my
turn will come around...

Well, you wanted to gamble, right? Go ahead and knock
yourself out before the stakes get too high.

Well, aren't you considerate? Fine, I'll do just that.
But don't worry. I have every intention of winning.
Well then, let's begin.

The total is...24?! Bust again?! That's three in a
row. So unlucky...

You're being too greedy. Since your opponent has to
keep drawing until they get over 17, sometimes it's
best to stop drawing cards once you pass 17.

While there is no loss in getting 21, you have to
understand that's not your primary aim.
I'm up next... Deal me in.
Very well... The first card in my hand is an 8.
I have a 5 and 6 for a total of 11...
Hit me.
Here's your third card—

Queen of Hearts... Face cards are worth 10, so that's
a total of 21.
I have a total of 17... Well played.

It's now one to three with house advantage.
Next round.
Stand. That's a total of 20.
I lose with 19. It's now five to three.
Ack... Four wins in a row! What is going on?!
Why are you upset...?
I'm upset because I'm the only one who lost.

What a selfish thing to say... Anyway, back to the
game... My hand is a total of 20.
Mine is a total of 11. Well, what will you do?

20... She has a solid hand. It only loses to 21.
The dealer also has a pretty good hand, but there's
a chance of busting. You should definitely stand—
Hit me.
...Here's your third card.
...An ace. And you?

...16. As I'm under 17, I'll need to draw another
card. That's a total of 24... Bust.
That makes it six to three... The bunny girls win.
I see... So you were counting cards.

Counting cards?! So you were tracking the order of
the cards in the deck! But when...?

She likely has an incredibly keen eye. She must have
watched the cards meticulously in the first three
rounds.

Furthermore, we often use new decks in cases like
this, which can result in a certain amount of bias
due to an insufficient shuffle.

I doubt she knew the exact order, but she could make
decisions based on estimates. She soundly defeated us.
I-I see...

Quite the impressive match. Let's move on to the next
game!

5.Text: The next game is roulette!

This time, we'll determine the winner by chip count,
not the number of wins. You win if you have at least
1,000 chips within 100 spins.

Your starting hand will be 100 chips... By the way,
you'll have to pay for your own chips. We wouldn't
want you to get complacent just because it's a game.

Oh, and just so you know, our casino chips are
100,000 zeni a piece. We pride ourselves in being
a high-class casino, after all.

(I-In other words, 10 million zeni?! Worst case
scenario, I may have to go begging to Gamma...!)
Is that around 10 million? No problem.

(She really has no sense of money... The royals are
truly frightening.)

Anyway, I'm sure you have something up your sleeve
for this game, too, right?

...No, it's not that simple. The odds are far worse
for this game.
...Around 94 percent.
Excuse me?

That's the rate of return in roulette. Blackjack, by
the way, is around 102 percent at best.

So, unlike Blackjack, the more you play...the more
money you lose?! That's so unfair!

It's not a charity, so of course, the house has the
advantage. In fact, Blackjack is the rare exception.
Now then, let's begin. Place your bets!
When are we supposed to place our bets?
We can bet now. I'll put one chip on black.
Black? You can bet on a color instead of a number?

Yes, if it's black, I win. If it's red, I lose. If it
lands on green 0 or 00, then the winner takes
all. It's easier to win but with less of a payoff.
In other words, a coward's way of betting?
Watch it...

(Calm down, Beta. Start by placing small bets with
high-probability odds and observe. You need to get
a read on the dealer if you're going to win...!)
Time to spin the ball! No more bets.
The result is...red 11.
I lose. There goes one chip.
Onto the next spin...!
Let's see. So far, it's landed on...

Red 11, red 25, black 6, black 1, red 27, black 29,
black 26, black 17, red 12, and black 8.
I-I'm surprised you remember all that...

That's a lot of black. Don't you think it'll land on
red soon?

It doesn't work that way. It's not like Blackjack,
where you have a fixed number of cards.

Excluding 0, the probability is 50-50 every time.
It may just keep landing on black forever.
Then what do we do? We've got to win...
Betting is about to end...
...One chip on red.

The result is...red 16. Congratulations. Here are
your winnings.

(We've gone through about ten spins without gaining
or losing any chips. This time, the dealer seems to
be consciously randomizing everything to avoid
giving away any tells.)

(Luckily, we've managed to maintain 50-50, but in the
long run, the odds are against us... What to do—)
That does it! I'm betting all the chips on 1!

Huh?! Wh-Wh-Wh-What are you doing?! Dealer, cancel
that bet—

Bets made by your partner are also considered valid.
Time is up, so no more bets.

Brace yourself. If it lands here, based on the rules,
we'll win. Even if we lose, we can win the next
game.

By the way, what happens if it lands on the single
number we bet everything on?

That's a multiple of 36, and since you bet 100 chips,
the payout would be 3,600 chips.

That's a considerable gain. I may have bet a little
too much, but if it lands on 1, we'll be the clear
winners.

Seriously!? I should've expected such outlandish and
reckless gambling from a royal! Not that your family
won't ultimately bail you out!
H-Hey!
A royal...?

I-I meant she acts like a royal...! It's a metaphor!
A metaphor!
...Time to spin the ball.
I'm getting excited!
(Waaah! Help me, my lord!)

6.Text: If it lands on 1, you win. Anything else, we win.

It's over... All my hard work is for nothing if we
lose this pivotal match... Ohh, what did I do to
deserve this...?
Well, sounds like a "you" problem.
It must be real nice not having anything to lose!

Relax. We're going to win this round! I've got a good
feeling about this!
Yeah, sure. Good luck with that.
We're just about to see the results...! Ohh...?!
O-Ooooone?!

S-See?! I won! C'mon, hand over my 3,600 chips!
Eeeek! I'm amazing!

M-My apologies...but we're out of chips. We hadn't
anticipated this outcome...
Huh? Well, that's no fun.
Wh-What astonishing luck... Unbelievable...

Such luck is unheard of! Unless we're talking about
the natural luck of the royals...!
(Well, she does happen to be a princess...)

Heehee! That gives us two wins in a row! What would
you like to play next? If it's poker, I know how to play.

No, we've already won two games, so we're the winner.
But thanks for the transparency that you're just here
to gamble.

By the way, since we had to self-fund the money we
gambled with...you'll, of course, be paying us our
wins, correct?

Ack! Oh dear. I hadn't expected us to exceed the
event budget... What will I tell the boss?
Boss...? But aren't you the boss—

What a poor showing, King. I came here because you
told me an interesting match was taking place, but
all I see is you losing badly to a couple of girls.
B-Boss...!

Boss...? King, you're not the one running this
casino?
No, I'm second in command... Joker there is the boss.

That's right. King was originally a customer, but I
hired him and gave him a high position due to his
excellent management skills.

But that's beside the point. King, Dealer, how will you
rectify this loss? Wouldn't you say these expenses
are a little too steep for an event?
M-My apologies. Forgive me...

I'm not defending them, but I'm pretty sure these
people were just doing their jobs.

Oh? You can't say they were "doing their jobs" when
they failed to consider unexpected losses. They'll
have to take full responsibility.

What an arrogant-looking guy... Being in my position,
I don't want to overlook the misery of my people. I'd
have difficulty sleeping at night, especially knowing
I was to blame.

What're you going on about...? If you're attempting
to overturn the results of a game, we'll have to take
appropriate action.

The guards who had been waiting in the wings surround
Beta and Alexia.

Fine! You already killed my winner's high by treating
me like I did something wrong! I'm pissed! I'll take on
all of you!

I was once a renowned warrior. I'm not averse to
settling this with force, but just know I won't go
easy on you!
Oh c'mon! We won! Why is this happening?!
Eeek! Sooo scary! I'm too young to die!

Hey, why are you hiding?! Where's all your bravado
from a moment ago?!

Waah...! I've never held anything heavier than a pen!
...So I'll leave the fighting to you!
Jeez, back me up, at least!

7.Text:
Ulp... Who would've thought she'd be physically
formidable as well? A complete miscalculation...
*pant, pant* Don't underestimate my strength.
Eeep... Is it over? That was sooo scary.
...Drop the act already.
Whaaat? What on earth do you mean?
Jeez, you're one annoying woman...
...As for the rest of you, don't get any ideas.

After such a spectacular rampage, I won't be
surprised if the Knight Order of Midgar Kingdom
arrives soon.

What?! This is between us! It's none of your
business!

Of course it's my business. I am Alexia Midgar,
Second Princess of the Midgar Kingdom.
...Wh-Whaaat?!
...Wh-Whaaaaaat?!
...Wh-Whaaaaaat?!
Y-You sure you're okay giving away your identity?

How else are we going to resolve this situation?
Anyway, I've enjoyed myself plenty already.

I had no idea you were the princess. Please, forgive
my disrespect...
And you? Are you an employee here?
Oh yes! All I know is there was a sudden commotion!

(I ultimately didn't get any sense that this casino
was connected to the Cult.)

(On the contrary, it was a regular casino with
excellent service. The only problem, if you could
call it that, was the boss's final use of force.)

(The bottom line is that I uncovered zero ties to the
Cult or any illicit operations. It was a wasted trip,
but every suspicion we quash is a good thing, right?)

It must've given you quite the fright to witness the
sudden commotion.

It was sooo frightening! But that lady right there was
strong, and she saved me. I had no idea she was
Princess Alexia.

What! Princess Alexia? What on earth are you doing
dressed like that?!

Y-You! Just because I said my name, it doesn't give
you the right to... Fine, two can play this game...

I was here as a guest of honor but ran into various
circumstances...
More importantly...what's Natsume Kafka doing here?

N-Natsume Kafka?! Now that you mention it, there
does seem to be a resemblance...!
What?! You must be confusing me with someone else!

(This woman! The moment she no longer needs to hide
her own identity...!)
D-Did you say "Natsume Kafka"?!

No doubt about it! A beautiful elf girl with silver hair,
blue eyes, and a beauty mark beneath her eye!
You really are Natsume Kafka!

I'm a huge fan! There's no way I'd confuse you for
anyone else! I carry your books with me everywhere,
especially Cinderella!
What a change in attitude...
I-I see... Thank you...

In fact, I'm thinking of setting my next novel in a
casino, which is why I came here for research...

I see! So that's why... If you had just said so, I'd have
shown you every nook and cranny of this place!
I apologize for my rudeness!

U-Um... If you don't mind, can I have your
signature?! Please! I beg you!

Hey, how about you back off? Excuse me, Lady Natsume.
While you're at it, could I also get your signature?
I'm actually a fan as well...
U-Um... I'm so glad to hear you say that...!
Ya-hoo!
Yippee!
What the hell is this charade...?

Please, everyone, calm down. I'm not going anywhere.
One at a time, please!

Following this, the incident was settled mutually
and the casino boss was released without incident,
thanks to Natsume's help.

Later that day, Natsume was welcomed into the casino
as an official guest and investigated every nook and
cranny under the guise of an interview.

Having found no particular connection to the Cult,
Natsume concluded this series of investigations.
